page.title: 03CONSERVATION AT LOWER MOUNT.
page.content: In recent years Lower Mount Farm has undertaken several conservation projects. Windmill Shaw, an area of about an acre of mixed woodland, was replanted early in May this year. The original wood was felled in the 1950's when there was a great demand for an increase in arable acreage. Now that there is no longer such a demand, it was decided to replant part of the woodland with oak, beech and birch. The farm lies on gravel beds, and in the last few years many thousands of tons of gravel have been dug out of part of the farm. At the end of the digging operation the top soil was replaced, and the land was put back to agricultural use. The only sign that any thing has happened to the fields is that now several of them are about 5 metres lower than the rest.
